header.p: A subset of the Jmol application is available for use as an applet.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: The Jmol applet requires Java 1.1 or later. Although, the applet should work with any browser, the latest Java Plug-in is recommended.

section.title: Downloading the applet
section.p:
To use the applet, you must first download the applet distribution and extract the files. It can be downloaded from SourceForge or using one of the following links:
jmol-applet-$APPLET-VERSION$.zip
jmol-applet-$APPLET-VERSION$.tar.gz

In the jars directory are several jar files. Some of them are optional. The jmol-applet.jar contains the majority of the applet and therefore is required. The vecmath1.1-1.12.jar contains linear algebra routines and is also required. The cdk-cml.jar and gnujaxp-saxonly.jar are used for reading CML files, and are optional. You will only need to include them if you wish to read CML files.

section.title: Creating a Web page
section.p:
To use the Jmol applet in a web page, use the <APPLET> tag with parameters specifying the molecule file to load. For example, the this HTML was used to display the applet seen below.
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="caffeine.xyz"/> </APPLET>

The following applet displays a CML file. Note the additional jars listed in the archive parameter.
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> </APPLET>

section.title: More applet examples
section.p: Examples of the applets showing animations can be found here. Also the Scripting page uses applets in the examples.

section.title: Applet parameters
section.p: The following parameters control the appearance and behavior of the applet. All parameter names and values are case insensitive.

appletParameterList.param: A file relative to the HTML page.

The background colour
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> <PARAM NAME="bgcolor" VALUE="black"/> </APPLET>

The atom and bond rendering style. One of:
SHADED
QUICKDRAW
WIREFRAME
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> <PARAM NAME="style" VALUE="QUICKDRAW"/> </APPLET>
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> <PARAM NAME="style" VALUE="WIREFRAME"/> </APPLET>

The labels to display for atoms. One of:
none do not display labels. symbol label atoms with their atomic symbol. number label atoms with their number.
The default value is NONE.
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> <PARAM NAME="label" VALUE="number"/> </APPLET>
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> <PARAM NAME="label" VALUE="symbol"/> </APPLET>

Whether or not to use the wireframe mode during rotations. One of:
ON
OFF
<APPLET CODE="JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="JmolApplet.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="load" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> <PARAM NAME="wireframeRotation" VALUE="ON"/> </APPLET>

section.title: Using the applet
section.p:
The following keys and mouse actions control the applet:
Left Mouse Button - rotates the molecule in x and y dimensions
Shift-Right Mouse Button - rotates the molecule in the z dimension
Ctrl-Right Mouse Button - translates the molecule
Shift-Left Mouse Button - zooms in and out
Ctrl-Left Mouse Button - controls the slab [if selected through scripting]
